page.title: 02Ramsden Village
page.content: Walking through Ramsden refreshed me. I forgot my bulky kit and hunger, but my mind was spellbound for the beauty of Ramsden. Ramsden appears as an old pubby place. In the taverns I could imagine an old, musty, mothbally smell where men drank beer laughing happily. Outside was completly different; a beautiful village without pollution by vehicles. It seemed like a new world free of evil. Would it be different when children returned from school? Would it spring back to life? Would cars start and Ramsden begin to be noisy? Ramsden is an elaborate expensive village with names on the cottages like The Dog, Ladysmith and Wychwood Lodge, where was parked #100,000 worth of cars. Today Ramsden is being modernisied for trendy families.
